subject: Business
title: IPO vs. Acquisition
description: A fast breakdown of IPO vs. Acquisition for builders.

hook.text: WhatsApp sold to Facebook for $19 billion. Snap went public at $24 billion. Different exits, both huge.

buildup.text: An IPO lets the public buy shares. An acquisition means a larger company buys yours outright.

discovery.text: IPOs raise capital and give liquidity, but bring public reporting and shareholder pressure.

twist.text: Most startups don't IPO. Over 90% of successful exits are acquisitions, often for far less.

climax.text: The choice depends on whether you want independence and scale or certainty and speed.

punchline.text: The best exit matches what you actually want.

quiz.question: What percentage of successful startup exits are acquisitions?
